body:
I'm starting to reach that point where it seems so difficult to improve and i need to find little things to work on. Can anyone give me some advanced PvP tips such as more advanced combos, counter-strafing, and cps improvement plz? Yes, I do watch top PvPer's videos but sometimes you need to get some info different ways.
 
Thanks, 

-ShadowSlayerZ7

title: Advanced PvP Tips

gg... I could see that you are trying to be better in PvP :P... You understand me xD
I'm the worst at pvp, but a tip is use the brain and think quickly, a arrow can shot you faster than you can do an iron armour :P

replies.body:
The arrow from a bow always comes out the right side, so when shooting from behind a wall always think of that.

Be as penguinful as you can.

Strafe alot

Practice MLG block placing 

That's about all I can thnk of at the top of my head

replies.body:
idk I just swing, strafe and kill ppl :P
 no rly much strategy... well not that ive thought about anyway lol
replies.body_tagged:
idk I just swing, strafe and kill ppl :P
 no rly much strategy... well not that ive thought about anyway lol

replies.body:
It takes a lot of good decision making in the moment. there's a lot of strategy involved. deciding what way to strafe, how to counter a move, how to break a combo, how you're going to get them into a combo, are you going to duel then or hold off for openings?

there's a lot of strategy and decision making it's just in the spur of the moment
replies.body_tagged:

there's a lot of strategy and decision making it's just in the spur of the moment

replies.body: I'm starting to play on Kohi and find it challenging yet fun but it's so much harder not knowing how to hotbar than it should be...
replies.body_tagged: I'm starting to play on Kohi and find it challenging yet fun but it's so much harder not knowing how to hotbar than it should be...

replies.body:
"... harder not knowing how to hotbar than it should be... "

What?
If you're talking about hotkeying, that takes practice but over time it should become pretty natural. And if your hotbar layout is confusing to you, that's probably because you need to create a new layout that isn't confusing. This applies to things like Hunger Games and Avicus as well :P
replies.body_tagged:
"... harder not knowing how to hotbar than it should be... "

What?
If you're talking about hotkeying, that takes practice but over time it should become pretty natural. And if your hotbar layout is confusing to you, that's probably because you need to create a new layout that isn't confusing. This applies to things like Hunger Games and Avicus as well :P

replies.body: It really depends on what type of PvP.
replies.body_tagged: It really depends on what type of PvP.

replies.body:
To be honest, no other technique matters as long as you can aim.

If your aim is crap, then don't even bother trying anything else.
replies.body_tagged:
To be honest, no other technique matters as long as you can aim.

If your aim is crap, then don't even bother trying anything else.

replies.body:
Some things in real life you can do

- Stay Hydrated
- Stay Warm but not sweating
- Be relaxed (easier said than done)


In game:
- Don't overthink it
- Try and see if the person you are versing does uses pattern and is predictable (mainly for long and extended fights aka potpvp)

replies.body:
It's much better if you teach yourself.

Practise makes perfect too. Keep playing 1v1 servers (such as Kohi).

replies.body:
Splade and I were 1v1ing on Kohi and we're even skill so it helps. We're working on recording a 1v1 but basically I don't use a mousepad and he comes over with his laptop so he switches to my PC for 1round of his PoV and then I switch but the surface is different so my aim gets thrown off and I'm not used to having 1/3 of the FPS I usually do on servers (120/130 - 40/50)...

Note: I'm way better on Kohi than in Nexus for any who say I'm not difficult or of equal PvP skill to Splade.
